intro: Cunonia varijuga, commonly known as the variable cunonia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits. Cunonia varijuga is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
